            </div> 
           </div> 
           <div class="pdf-viewer-page"> 
            <div id="pf4" class="pf w0 h0" data-page-no="4">
             <div class="pc pc4 w0 h0">
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y40 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse ws146">
               the objective functions at the next batch of sample values
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y41 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse ws156">
               tend to be smaller.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y43 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls61 ws157">
               4. 
               <span class="ff19 lsc4 ws158">Convergence: </span>
               <span class="lsd7 ws159">S<span class="_ _10"></span>t<span class="_ _10"></span>o<span class="_ _7"></span>pt<span class="_ _10"></span>h<span class="_ _7"></span>es<span class="_ _10"></span>e<span class="_ _10"></span>a<span class="_ _7"></span>r<span class="_ _10"></span>c<span class="_ _10"></span>hw<span class="_ _7"></span>h<span class="_ _10"></span>e<span class="_ _10"></span>nt<span class="_ _7"></span>h<span class="_ _10"></span>es<span class="_ _10"></span>m<span class="_ _7"></span>a<span class="_ _10"></span>l<span class="_ _7"></span>l<span class="_ _10"></span>e<span class="_ _10"></span>s<span class="_ _7"></span>t</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y44 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls25 ws15a">
               values of the objective function do not change in a given
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y45 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls19 ws15b">
               number of iterations.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y125 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls6 ws15c">
               The CE algorithm requires users to set a number of
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y47 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls28 ws15d">
               parameters. Convergence to a global optimal solution in
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y48 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls2f ws15e">
               many ways depends on the parameters chosen. It is
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y49 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse ws15f">
               recommended that the number of samples 
               <span class="ff8 lsc5">N</span>
               <span class="ls6 ws160">for each</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y4a ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls40 ws161">
               stage is to be set to at least 10
               <span class="ff8 ls1e">k</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m1 x4b h36 y14f ff4 fs7 fc0 sc0 ls1e">
               2
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x3c hd y150 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsf ws162">
               (in case, 
               <span class="ff8 lsc6">n</span>
               <span class="ls61 ws163">&gt;&gt; <span class="ff8 ls50">k</span><span class="ws164">, 10<span class="ff8 ls50 ws165">kn</span><span class="ls1e">,</span></span></span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y151 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse ws166">
               where 
               <span class="ff8 lsc7">n</span>
               <span class="ls25 ws167">is the total number of unique elements being</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y152 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls29 ws168">
               ordered 
               <span class="ff8 lsc8">k</span>
               <span class="lse ws169">at a time) and the rarity parameter <span class="ff1a lsc9">r</span><span class="ls1e ws16a">used in</span></span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y153 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls2f ws16b">
               updating the cell probabilities is to be set to 0.01 if 
               <span class="ff8 lsca">N</span>
               <span class="ls3a">is</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y154 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls10 ws16c">
               relatively large or 0.1 if 
               <span class="ff8 lscb">N</span>
               <span class="ls5 ws16d">is small (less than 100).</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 h13 y155 fff fsc fc0 sc0 lscc ws16e">
               Genetic algorithm
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y156 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls15 ws16f">
               Genetic algorithms are another set of tools suitable for
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y157 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls5 ws41">
               solving complex combinatorial problems [8]. Their main
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y158 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls34 ws170">
               advantage is their inherent simplicity in both conceptual
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y159 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse ws171">
               understanding and software implementation. In our
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y15a ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsf ws172">
               experience, the GA performs reasonably well for the
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y15b ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls18 ws173">
               aggregation problem but one has to be careful with the
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y15c ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls2f ws174">
               selection of important tuni
               <span class="ls3b ws175">ng parameters which control</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y15d ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls52 ws176">
               t
               <span class="_ _9"></span>h
               <span class="_ _9"></span>er
               <span class="_ _9"></span>a
               <span class="_ _9"></span>t
               <span class="_ _9"></span>eo
               <span class="_ _9"></span>ft
               <span class="_ _9"></span>h
               <span class="_ _9"></span>el
               <span class="_ _9"></span>e
               <span class="_ _9"></span>a
               <span class="_ _9"></span>r
               <span class="_ _9"></span>n
               <span class="_ _9"></span>i
               <span class="_ _9"></span>n
               <span class="_ _9"></span>gp
               <span class="_ _9"></span>r
               <span class="_ _9"></span>o
               <span class="_ _9"></span>c
               <span class="_ _9"></span>e
               <span class="_ _c"></span>s
               <span class="_ _9"></span>s
               <span class="_ _9"></span>.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y15e ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lscd ws177">
               As implemented in this package, the GA has the
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y15f ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls5 ws178">
               following steps:
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y160 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsd8 ws179">
               1. 
               <span class="ff19 lsd9 ws17a">Initialization: </span>
               <span class="lsda wsfc">Randomly select <span class="ff8 lsdb ws17b">popSize </span><span class="lsdc ws17c">ordered lists of size</span></span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y161 ff8 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsce">
               k
               <span class="ff4 lsdd ws17d">which form the initial population of possible solutions to</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y162 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsdd ws17e">
               our optimization problem. The population size 
               <span class="ff8 lsdb ws17f">popSize </span>
               <span class="lsde">is</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y163 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsdf ws180">
               important and, obviously, the larger the population size, the
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y164 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse0 ws11f">
               better chance of it containi
               <span class="lse1 ws181">ng, at some point, the optimal</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y165 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsdd ws182">
               solution. It should ideally be a function of 
               <span class="ff8 lscf">k</span>
               <span class="lse2 ws183">and the number</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y166 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse3 ws3f">
               of unique elements in the original ordered lists 
               <span class="ff8 ls1e">L</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m1 x5d he y167 ff8 fs7 fc0 sc0 ls1e">
               i
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5d hd y168 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsdc ws184">
               , but
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y169 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsdc ws185">
               computational feasibility has to be considered here.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y16a ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls61 ws186">
               2. 
               <span class="ff19 ls7 ws187">Selection: </span>
               <span class="ls1e ws188">Dependin<span class="_ _1"></span>g on which dis<span class="_ _1"></span>tance is use<span class="_ _1"></span>d,</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y16b ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls3b ws189">
               compute the objective function for each member of the
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y16c ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls11 ws18a">
               population. Then randomly select current members for
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y16d ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls5 ws18b">
               the next generation using weighted random sampling
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y16e ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsa ws18c">
               where the weights are determined by the member's
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y16f ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls6 ws18d">
               fitness (the objective function score).
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y170 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls61 ws18e">
               3. 
               <span class="ff19 ls2f ws18f">Cross-over: </span>
               <span class="lsf ws190">The selected members are then crossed-</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y171 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls28 ws191">
               over with the probability of 
               <span class="ff8 ls11 ws192">CP </span>
               <span class="ls1e ws193">(the cros<span class="_ _1"></span>s-over pro<span class="_ _1"></span>b-</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y172 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls11 ws194">
               ability), i.e. two random ordered lists can swap their tails
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y173 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls11 ws195">
               which start at a random position with the 
               <span class="ff8 ws196">CP </span>
               <span class="ls19 ws197">prob-</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y174 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls81 ws96">
               ability. Only 1-point cross-overs are allowed.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y175 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls2a ws198">
               4. 
               <span class="ff19 ls4f ws199">Mutation: </span>
               <span class="lsc0 ws19a">Crossing-over will allow only for the</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y176 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls5 ws19b">
               mixing of ordered lists but a rather drastic event is
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y177 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls5 ws19c">
               required to bring radically new solutions to the popula-
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y178 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse ws19d">
               tion pool. These are introduced by mutations which
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y179 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsf ws19e">
               happen with the probability of MP (mutation prob-
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y17a ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsf ws19f">
               ability). Thus, any list in the pool can randomly change
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y17b ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsc ws1a0">
               one or more of its elements.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y17c ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls4a ws1a1">
               5. 
               <span class="ff19 lsd0 ws1a2">Convergence: </span>
               <span class="lsd1 ws1a3">The algorithm is stopped if the</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y17d ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsf ws1a4">
               "optimal" list remains optimal for 
               <span class="ff8 ls1e ws1a5">convIn </span>
               <span class="ls17">consecutive</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y17e ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls28 ws1a6">
               generations (default is 15). To ensure that the algorithm
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y17f ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls28 ws1a7">
               stops running eventually, the maximum number of
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y180 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls6 ws1a8">
               generations can be set in advance which will terminate
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y181 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls6 ws1a9">
               the execution regardless of the first condition being true.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y182 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls6 ws1aa">
               If neither the maximum number of iterations has been
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y183 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls28 ws1ab">
               reached nor the "optimal" list stayed untouched during
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y184 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls11 ws45">
               the last 
               <span class="ff8 ls1e ws1ac">convIn </span>
               <span class="ls13 ws19">generations, continue to step Selec<span class="_ _1"></span>tion.</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y185 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsd2 ws1ad">
               As was mentioned previously, the choice of the
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y186 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls13 ws1ae">
               parameters 
               <span class="ff8 lse4 ws1af">popSize</span>
               <span class="lsd3">,<span class="ff8 ls11 wsb5">CP</span><span class="ws1b0">,a<span class="_ _9"></span>n<span class="_ _9"></span>d<span class="ff8 ls3f ws1b1">MP </span><span class="ls2f ws1b2">is crucial for the success</span></span></span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y187 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls40 ws1b3">
               of the GA. If one is too conservative and selects small 
               <span class="ff8 ls11">CP</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y188 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls3c ws1b4">
               and 
               <span class="ff8 lse5 ws1b5">MP </span>
               <span class="ls11 ws1b6">probabilities, the GA will have a hard time</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y189 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls40 ws1b7">
               exploring the space of possible solutions in a reasonable
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y18a ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls29 ws1b8">
               time, particularly, when the space is extremely large. On
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y18b ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls29 wsf3">
               the other hand, choosing large values for 
               <span class="ff8 ls11 ws1b9">CP </span>
               <span class="ls3c ws1ba">and <span class="ff8 ls3f ws1bb">MP </span><span class="ls7">will</span></span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y18c ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls15 ws1bc">
               results in a "haste" decision, perhaps getting trapped in a
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y18d ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls2f ws1bd">
               local minimum without a chance to explore the whole
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y18e ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls40 ws16c">
               search space.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 ha y18f ff3 fs5 fc0 sc0 lsd4 ws1be">
               Results and Discussion
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y190 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsa ws1bf">
               We illustrate our R package with two different rank
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y191 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls2f ws1c0">
               aggregation problems, one in the context of unsuper-
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y192 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls3b ws1c1">
               vised learning where there is an intrinsic difficulty of
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y193 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls28 ws1c2">
               choosing the best clustering algorithm for a particular
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y194 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls11 ws1c3">
               problem, and another one in the context of meta-
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y195 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls17 ws1c4">
               analysis of several microarray cancer studies where the
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y196 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls17 ws1c5">
               goal is to determine the combined set of genes indicative
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y197 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls15 ws1c6">
               of the cancer status.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y198 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls6 ws1c7">
               To start using the 
               <span class="ff8 lsa ws1c8">RankAggreg </span>
               <span class="ws80">package, it must be loaded</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y199 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls15 ws1c9">
               into R [9] with the regular 
               <span class="ff8 lsd5 ws1ca">library( ) </span>
               <span class="lse6 ws1cb">function, <span class="ff8 ls3c ws1cc">library</span></span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y19a ff8 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsba ws1cd">
               (RankAggreg)
               <span class="ff4 lse ws1ce">. Package documentation, examples, and</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y19b ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls18 ws70">
               additional informatio
               <span class="ls17 ws1cf">n are available through <span class="ff8 lsa ws1d0">help(pack-</span></span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y19c ff8 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls2f ws1d1">
               age = "RankAggreg") 
               <span class="ff4 ls3c ws1d2">and </span>
               <span class="lsa ws1d3">vignette("RankAggreg") <span class="ff4 ls43 ws1d4">func-</span></span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y19d ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse">
               tions.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 h13 y19e fff fsc fc0 sc0 lse7 ws1d5">
               Aggregation of clusterin
               <span class="lsd6 ws1d6">g validation measures</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y19f ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls2f ws1d7">
               Rank aggregation in the clustering context was intro-
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1a0 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls2c ws1d8">
               duced by [5]. Numerous clustering algorithms are
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1a1 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls3b ws1d9">
               available in R and other statistical and data mining
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1a2 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls7 ws14c">
               software packages, each one having its relative strengths
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1a3 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls18 ws1da">
               and weaknesses in terms of how successfully they can
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1a4 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls17 ws1db">
               handle certain types of data. Thus, it is often difficult to
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1a5 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls17 ws1dc">
               select the "best" algorithm for a particular clustering task.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1a6 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls18 ws1dd">
               Validation (performance) measures come to rescue to
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1a7 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls28 ws1de">
               some extent and offer an objective way of ranking
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hf yc2 ffa fs8 fc0 sc0 ls53 wsc4">
               BMC Bioinformatics 
               <span class="ff9 ls1a wsc5">2009, <span class="ff16 ls1e wsc6">10</span><span class="ls54 wsc7">:62 http://www.biomedcentral.com/1471-2105/10<span class="_ _16"></span>/<span class="_ _1"></span>62</span></span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x6 hf yc3 ff9 fs8 fc0 sc0 ls1a ws46">
               Page 4 of 10
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x7 h10 y3d ffa fs9 fc0 sc0 ls1b ws47">
               (page number not for citation purposes)
              </div>
              <a class="l" href="publication/24026315_RankAggreg_an_R_package_for_weighted_rank_aggregation#pfa" data-dest-detail="[10,&quot;FitR&quot;,0,792,611,0]">
               <div class="d m2" style="border-style:none;position:absolute;left:377.426658px;bottom:742.558654px;width:5.443000px;height:9.751000px;background-color:rgba(255,255,255,0.000001);"></div></a>
              <a class="l" href="publication/24026315_RankAggreg_an_R_package_for_weighted_rank_aggregation#pfa" data-dest-detail="[10,&quot;FitR&quot;,0,792,611,0]">
               <div class="d m2" style="border-style:none;position:absolute;left:560.858568px;bottom:394.732040px;width:5.442000px;height:9.695000px;background-color:rgba(255,255,255,0.000001);"></div></a>
              <a class="l" href="publication/24026315_RankAggreg_an_R_package_for_weighted_rank_aggregation#pfa" data-dest-detail="[10,&quot;FitR&quot;,0,792,611,0]">
               <div class="d m2" style="border-style:none;position:absolute;left:587.999036px;bottom:234.798628px;width:5.556000px;height:9.752000px;background-color:rgba(255,255,255,0.000001);"></div></a>
             </div>
             <div class="pi" data-data="{&quot;ctm&quot;:[1.606515,0.000000,0.000000,1.606515,0.000000,0.000000]}"></div>
            </div> 
           </div> 
           <div class="pdf-viewer-page"> 
            <div id="pf5" class="pf w0 h0" data-page-no="5">
             <div class="pc pc5 w0 h0">
              <div class="bi x1 y1a8 w3 h3b lazyload" data-bg="profile/Somnath_Datta2/publication/24026315/viewer/AS:209103138889735@1426865481825/background/5.png" style="background-size: contain;"></div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y40 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls96 ws57">
               clustering algorithms according to their assessment of
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y41 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse8 ws1df">
               what a "good" clustering result is. If 
               <span class="ff8 lse9">k</span>
               <span class="lsea ws1e0">clustering</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y42 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls28 ws1e1">
               algorithms are validated with 
               <span class="ff8 lseb">m</span>
               <span class="ls17 ws1e2">validation measures, <span class="ff8 ls1e">m</span></span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y43 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse ws1e3">
               ordered lists of size 
               <span class="ff8 lsec">k</span>
               <span class="ls17 ws1e4">are produced as a result. Even</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y44 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls5 ws1e5">
               though desirable, the order of clustering algorithms
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y45 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls18 ws1e6">
               within each list is rarely the same. Rank aggregation is
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y46 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls18 ws1e7">
               helpful in reconciling the ranks and producing the
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y125 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsf ws1e8">
               "super"-list which determines the overall winner and
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y47 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsfb ws1e9">
               also ranks all clustering algorithms based on the
               <span class="_ _1"></span>ir
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y48 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsed ws1ea">
               performance as determined by all 
               <span class="ff8 lsee">m</span>
               <span class="lsef ws1eb">validation</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y49 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsf0 ws1ec">
               measures simultaneously. Clustering validation is
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y4a ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls2f ws1ed">
               implemented in the 
               <span class="ff8 ls1e ws1ee">clValid </span>
               <span class="ls18 ws1ef">package [10]. After loading</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y4b ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls1e ws1f0">
               the package
               <span class="_ _1"></span>, we bring i
               <span class="_ _1"></span>n a mouse micr
               <span class="_ _1"></span>oarray da
               <span class="_ _1"></span>taset
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y4c ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls29 ws1f1">
               and select the first 100 genes from it. Assuming that
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y4d ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls28 ws1f2">
               those 100 genes form 5 natural clusters (this is an ad-
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y4e ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls3b ws1f3">
               hoc assumption but it is not essential for the rank
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y4f ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls25 ws1f4">
               aggregation demonstration), we evaluate 10 clustering
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y50 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsf1 ws1f5">
               algorithms with 6 validation measures. Available
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y51 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls2a ws1f6">
               clustering algorithms are: SOM (SM), SOTA (ST),
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y52 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsb ws1f7">
               FANNY (FN), K-Means(KM), PAM(PM), Hierarchical
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y53 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls7 ws1f8">
               (HR), Agnes(AG), CLARA(CL), Diana(DI), and Model-
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y54 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls5 ws1f9">
               based(MO). Further details can be obtained from the
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y55 ff8 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls3b ws135">
               clValid 
               <span class="ff4 ls11 ws1fa">package documentation.</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y57 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls3b ws1fb">
               For each validation measure, 10 clustering algorithms
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y58 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls3b ws1fc">
               can now be ranked based on the performance scores
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y59 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls25 ws1fd">
               which are sorted either in ascending or descending order
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y5a ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls6 ws1fe">
               depending on whether larger or smaller scores corre-
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y5b ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls6 ws1ff">
               spond to better performance under the measure. Here,
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y5c ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls29 ws1b8">
               the Dunn index and the Silhouette Width measures give
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1a9 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse ws200">
               higher scores with better performance and for the other
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1aa ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls11 ws45">
               measures the smaller scores are desirable.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1ab ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls9 ws201">
               The 7 ordered lists of 10 algorithms are shown in
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1ac ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls18 ws1da">
               Table 1. Their corresponding weights (validation mea-
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1ad ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls8 ws202">
               sure scores) which were used to rank the 10 algorithms
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1ae ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls11 ws203">
               within each ordered list (in rows) are shown in Table 2.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1af ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls17 ws204">
               We can see that both SOM and Hierarchical clustering
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1b0 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls1e ws205">
               are perfor
               <span class="_ _1"></span>ming quite w
               <span class="_ _1"></span>ell and each is r
               <span class="_ _1"></span>anked firs
               <span class="_ _1"></span>t by
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1b1 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls13 ws206">
               three different validation measures. If we had to pick th
               <span class="_ _1"></span>e
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1b2 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls65 ws207">
               overall winner, it would probably be SOM as it performs
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1b3 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse ws208">
               better overall. For this particular aggregation problem it
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1b4 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls5 ws209">
               is feasible to determine the best performer without
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1b5 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls40 ws1dc">
               resorting to advanced computational techniques, but it is
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1b6 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls11 ws20a">
               rather difficult to obtain the overall ordered list in this
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1b7 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls28 ws20b">
               case. Since the number of possible solutions is not that
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1b8 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls3a ws20c">
               large (
               <span class="ff8 ls50">k</span>
               <span class="ls3c ws20d">! = 10! = 3, 628, 800), it is feasible to use the</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1b9 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse ws20e">
               brute force approach to find the optimal solution. This
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1ba ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls28 ws20f">
               can be done using the 
               <span class="ff8 lsc4 ws210">BruteAggreg( ) </span>
               <span class="ls11 ws211">function provided</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1bb ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse ws212">
               in the package. Please note that even for this relatively
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1bc ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls29 ws213">
               small problem it takes hours to perform the necessary
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1bd ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls6 ws214">
               computations. The approach is limited to toy examples
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1be ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls6 ws19f">
               only and should not be attempted if 
               <span class="ff8 lsf2">k</span>
               <span class="lsf ws215">is larger than 10.</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1bf ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse ws216">
               The R code to perform the brut
               <span class="ls1e ws217">e force rank agg<span class="_ _1"></span>regation i<span class="_ _1"></span>s</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 h1a y1c0 ff8 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls1e ws218">
               &gt; BruteAgg
               <span class="_ _1"></span>reg(rank
               <span class="_ _1"></span>s, 10, weig
               <span class="_ _1"></span>hts, "Spea
               <span class="_ _1"></span>rman")
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1c1 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse ws13">
               Here, the first argument is the matrix of ordered lists (in
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1c2 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls29 ws219">
               rows), the second argument is the size of the resulting
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 h8 y1c3 ff3 fs4 fc0 sc0 ls1e ws21a">
               Table 2: Vali
               <span class="_ _1"></span>dation scores
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x46 h3c y1c4 ff3 fs1d fc0 sc0 lsf3 ws21b">
               123456789
               <span class="_ _7"></span>1
               <span class="_ _22"></span>0
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 h3d y1c5 ff5 fs1d fc0 sc0 lsfc ws21c">
               APN
               <span class="_ _35"> </span>0.11 0.12 0.15 0.15 0.17 0.17 0.17 0.18 0.18 0.26
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 h3d y1c6 ff5 fs1d fc0 sc0 lsf4 ws21d">
               AD
               <span class="_ _36"> </span>1.63 1.67 1.70 1.71 1.71 1.74 1.83 1.85 1.85 2.50
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 h3d y1c7 ff5 fs1d fc0 sc0 lsfd ws21e">
               ADM
               <span class="_ _37"> </span>0.28 0.31 0.37 0.47 0.48 0.48 0.57 0.63 0.63 0.85
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 h3d y1c8 ff5 fs1d fc0 sc0 lsfd ws21f">
               FOM
               <span class="_ _38"> </span>0.57 0.58 0.58 0.59 0.59 0.59 0.60 0.68 0.68 0.80
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 h3d y1c9 ff5 fs1d fc0 sc0 lsf5 ws220">
               Connectivity
               <span class="_ _18"> </span>23.91 23.91 35.44 36.09 37.49 38.40 38.82 39.58 39.84 49.93
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 h3d y1ca ff5 fs1d fc0 sc0 lsf5 ws221">

               <span class="_ _37"> </span>0.17 0.17 0.12 0.11 0.11 0.11 0.08 0.08 0.08 0.06
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 h3d y1cb ff5 fs1d fc0 sc0 lsf6 ws222">
               Silhouette
               <span class="_ _39"> </span>0.39 0.39 0.38 0.36 0.35 0.35 0.33 0.31 0.30 0.16
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 h3d y1cc ff5 fs1d fc0 sc0 lsf7 ws223">
               Clustering validation scores for each validation measure as produced by the 
               <span class="ff6 lsf8 ws224">clValid </span>
               <span class="lsf9 ws225">package. Please note that the rows are ordered in either ascending</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 h3d y1cd ff5 fs1d fc0 sc0 lsf9 ws226">
               or descending order depending whether larger or smaller sco
               <span class="lsf7 ws227">res are desirable for a particular validation measure.</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 h8 y1ce ff3 fs4 fc0 sc0 ls1e ws228">
               Table 1: Clus
               <span class="_ _1"></span>tering algori
               <span class="_ _1"></span>thms ranks
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x54 h3c y1cf ff3 fs1d fc0 sc0 lsfe ws229">
               123 45 67
               <span class="_ _1"></span>8 9
               <span class="_ _1"></span>1

               ADM

              </div>

               Connectivity HR AG DI
               <span class="_ _8"> </span>KM MO SM

               Dunn

               <span class="_ _3f"> </span>SM

               Silhouette
               <span class="_ _40"> </span>HR AG KM SM
               <span class="_ _3b"> </span>CL

               <span class="_ _3f"> </span>FN
               <span class="_ _1e"> </span>MO
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 h3d y1d7 ff5 fs1d fc0 sc0 ls1e ws231">
               10 clustering al
               <span class="_ _0"></span>gorithms rank
               <span class="_ _0"></span>ed by 7 validation meas
               <span class="_ _16"></span>ures (in rows). The rank of 1 means that the algori
               <span class="_ _16"></span>thm received the best scored from a part
               <span class="_ _0"></span>icular validati
               <span class="_ _16"></span>on
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 h3d y1d8 ff5 fs1d fc0 sc0 ls1e ws232">
               measure. For exam
               <span class="_ _16"></span>ple, SOM is deemed to be the best algorithm by APN, AD, an
               <span class="_ _16"></span>d
               <span class="_ _2"> </span>FOM me
               <span class="_ _0"></span>asures, while MO is rank
               <span class="_ _16"></span>ed last by 5 out of 7 measures.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hf yc2 ffa fs8 fc0 sc0 ls53 wsc4">
               BMC Bioinformatics 
               <span class="ff9 ls1a wsc5">2009, <span class="ff16 ls1e wsc6">10</span><span class="ls54 wsc7">:62 http://www.biomedcentral.com/1471-2105/10<span class="_ _16"></span>/<span class="_ _1"></span>62</span></span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x6 hf yc3 ff9 fs8 fc0 sc0 ls1a ws46">
               Page 5 of 10
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x7 h10 y3d ffa fs9 fc0 sc0 ls1b ws47">
               (page number not for citation purposes)
              </div>
              <a class="l" href="publication/24026315_RankAggreg_an_R_package_for_weighted_rank_aggregation#pfa" data-dest-detail="[10,&quot;FitR&quot;,0,792,611,0]">
               <div class="d m2" style="border-style:none;position:absolute;left:349.648403px;bottom:911.872508px;width:10.942000px;height:9.751000px;background-color:rgba(255,255,255,0.000001);"></div></a>
              <a class="l" href="publication/24026315_RankAggreg_an_R_package_for_weighted_rank_aggregation#pf5" data-dest-detail="[5,&quot;FitR&quot;,0,792,611,0]">
               <div class="d m2" style="border-style:none;position:absolute;left:545.648081px;bottom:1043.571415px;width:5.443000px;height:9.695000px;background-color:rgba(255,255,255,0.000001);"></div></a>
              <a class="l" href="publication/24026315_RankAggreg_an_R_package_for_weighted_rank_aggregation#pf5" data-dest-detail="[5,&quot;FitR&quot;,0,792,611,0]">
               <div class="d m2" style="border-style:none;position:absolute;left:875.897813px;bottom:1005.956467px;width:5.442000px;height:9.695000px;background-color:rgba(255,255,255,0.000001);"></div></a>
             </div>
             <div class="pi" data-data="{&quot;ctm&quot;:[1.606515,0.000000,0.000000,1.606515,0.000000,0.000000]}"></div>
            </div> 
           </div> 
           <div class="pdf-viewer-page"> 
            <div id="pf6" class="pf w0 h0" data-page-no="6">
             <div class="pc pc6 w0 h0">
              <div class="bi x5 y1d9 w4 h3e lazyload" data-bg="profile/Somnath_Datta2/publication/24026315/viewer/AS:209103138889735@1426865481825/background/6.png" style="background-size: contain;"></div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y40 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls3b ws233">
               top list which is 10 in this case, the third argument
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y41 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls15 ws234">
               specifies the matrix of weights which is normalized by
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y42 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse wsa2">
               the procedure (note that there is no need to worry about
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y43 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse ws235">
               mixing both ascending and descending orders; the only
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y44 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls28 ws236">
               requirement is that the rows must be sorted), and the last
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y45 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse ws237">
               argument indicates that we want to use the Spearman
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y46 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls25 ws238">
               footrule distance as the measure of similarity between
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y125 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse ws239">
               two ordered lists. The best overall list as determined by
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y47 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsf wsf5">
               trying all possible solutions with the weighted Spearman
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y48 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse ws7f">
               footrule distance is SM HR KM FN AG PM CL DI ST MO
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y49 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsf ws23a">
               with the minimum objective function score of 5.552256.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y4a ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsf wsfe">
               As expected, SOM and Hierarchical clustering are the top
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y4b ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse ws23b">
               two performers, followed by 
               <span class="ls7 ws23c">the K-Means algorithm. We</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y4c ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsd5 ws23d">
               will now see whether the CE algorithm can qu
               <span class="_ _1"></span>ickly
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y4d ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse ws23e">
               discover the solution without resorting to an exhaustive
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y4e ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsf">
               search.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y50 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls81 ws23f">
               The 
               <span class="ff8 ls6 ws240">RankAggreg( ) </span>
               <span class="ls11 ws4e">function performs rank aggregation</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y51 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls1e ws241">
               using eith
               <span class="_ _1"></span>er the CE algo
               <span class="_ _1"></span>rithm or th
               <span class="_ _1"></span>e GA algorit
               <span class="_ _1"></span>hm. If the
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y52 ff8 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse ws242">
               verbose 
               <span class="ff4 ws243">argument of the </span>
               <span class="lsd ws244">RankAggreg( ) <span class="ff4 ls1e ws245">function i<span class="_ _1"></span>s set to</span></span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y53 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse ws246">
               TRUE (it is by default), R console window outputs
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y54 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls7 ws247">
               information at each iteration to keep the user updated.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y55 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls11 ws248">
               In addition, a plot similar to Figure 1 is shown and
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y56 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls18 ws249">
               updated at each iteration to monitor convergence.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y58 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsc0 ws24a">
               Running the following code in R
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 h1a y5a ff8 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls28 ws24b">
               &gt; RankAggreg(ranks, 10, weights, seed = 123)
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y5c ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls2f ws24c">
               performs the rank aggregation using the CE algorithm.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y5d ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls6 ws24d">
               We get exactly the same solut
               <span class="ls103 ws24e">i<span class="_ _c"></span>o<span class="_ _c"></span>ni<span class="_ _c"></span>no<span class="_ _c"></span>n<span class="_ _c"></span>l<span class="_ _c"></span>y1<span class="_ _c"></span>3i<span class="_ _9"></span>t<span class="_ _c"></span>e<span class="_ _c"></span>r<span class="_ _c"></span>a<span class="_ _c"></span>t<span class="_ _c"></span>i<span class="_ _c"></span>o<span class="_ _c"></span>n<span class="_ _c"></span>s</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y5e ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls29 ws24f">
               and in about 40 seconds by examining mere 13000
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y5f ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls1e ws6d">
               potential
               <span class="_ _2"> </span>candidat
               <span class="_ _1"></span>es. The CE algo
               <span class="_ _1"></span>rithm wa
               <span class="_ _1"></span>s run 20 times
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y60 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls13 ws250">
               using the default values with 20 different seeds. Only 1
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y61 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls25 ws251">
               out of 20 times it failed to discover the optimal solution,
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y62 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls40 ws139">
               switching the K-Means and SOM algorithms.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1da ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls2f ws103">
               To get a visual representation of the results, a convenient
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1db ff8 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls29 ws252">
               plot( ) 
               <span class="ff4 ls11 ws253">function is provided. It takes the object returned</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1dc ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls18 ws254">
               by the 
               <span class="ff8 ls1e ws255">RankAggr<span class="_ _1"></span>eg( ) <span class="ff4 ws256">functi<span class="_ _1"></span>on as its fi<span class="_ _1"></span>rst argume<span class="_ _1"></span>nt and</span></span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1dd ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls28 ws257">
               outputs three side-by-side plots with useful information
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1de ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls40 ws258">
               on the convergence properties and the final ranking.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1df ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls28 ws259">
               From these plots we see that already after 7 iterations the
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1e0 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls28 ws25a">
               CE algorithm found the optimal solution. The distribu-
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1e1 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls6 ws25b">
               tion of the final Monte Carlo sample is shown in the
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1e2 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls15 ws9e">
               second plot. Most of the mass is put on the optimal
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1e3 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls9 ws25c">
               value (most of the candidate lists are the same "optimal"
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1e4 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse ws25d">
               list). The last plot visualizes ordered lists to be combined
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1e5 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsfb ws25e">
               and the resulting solution.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1e6 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls6 ws25f">
               Figure 1: Visual Representation of the aggregation results
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1e7 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls11 ws260">
               through the 
               <span class="ff8 ls29 ws261">plot( ) </span>
               <span class="ls104 ws262">function. The first plot in the top row</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1e8 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls3b ws263">
               shows the path of minimum values of the objective
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1e9 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls9 ws264">
               function over time. The global minimum is shown in the
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1ea ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls43 ws265">
               top right corner. The histogram of the objective function
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1eb ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls2f ws266">
               scores at the last iteration is displayed in the second plot.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1ec ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls2f ws267">
               Looking at these two plots, one can get a general idea
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1ed ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls2f ws268">
               about the rate of convergence and the distribution of
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1ee ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls3b ws269">
               candidate lists at the last iteration. The third plot at the
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1ef ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsd ws26a">
               bottom shows the individual lists and the obtained
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1f0 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls3b ws26b">
               solution along with optional average ranking.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1f1 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls1e ws26c">
               Weighted K
               <span class="_ _1"></span>endall's t
               <span class="_ _1"></span>au distanc
               <span class="_ _1"></span>e can also be u
               <span class="_ _1"></span>sed, thoug
               <span class="_ _1"></span>h
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1f2 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls34 ws26d">
               it is much more expensive to compute.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 h1a y1f3 ff8 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls1e ws26e">
               &gt; RankAggre
               <span class="_ _16"></span>g(ranks, 10, weights
               <span class="_ _16"></span>, "CE", "Kendall", se
               <span class="_ _16"></span>ed = 123)
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1f4 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsa ws26f">
               The overall list is given by KM SM PM FN HR AG CL DI
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1f5 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls17 ws1c5">
               ST MO with the value of 1.241372. Thus, the SOM is put
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1f6 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls5 ws270">
               in the second position with K-Means occupying the first
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1f7 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls1e ws271">
               place. Mayb
               <span class="_ _1"></span>e somewha
               <span class="_ _1"></span>t surprisi
               <span class="_ _1"></span>ngly, the Hi
               <span class="_ _1"></span>erarchic
               <span class="_ _1"></span>al
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y1f8 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls9 ws272">
               clustering (HR) algorithm is ranked fifth despite the fact
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5b h3f y1f9 ff1b fs1e fc5 sc0 ls105 ws273">
               2468
               <span class="_ _16"></span>1
               <span class="_ _41"></span>0

              <div class="t mc x5e h3f y1fa ff1b fs1e fc5 sc0 ls1e ws274">

               <span class="_ _1"></span>hm
               <span class="ff5 lsa ws27c">. Visual Representation of the aggregation</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hc y20a ff5 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls1e ws211">
               results th
               <span class="_ _1"></span>rough the 
               <span class="ff6 ls28 ws27d">plot( ) </span>
               <span class="ls102 ws27e">function<span class="_ _2"> </span>for the Clustering</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hc y20b ff5 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls13 ws27f">
               example using the CE algorithm and the Spearman footrule
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hc y20c ff5 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls13 ws280">
               distance. The first plot in the top row shows the path of
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hc y20d ff5 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls8 ws281">
               minimum values of the objective function over time. The
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hc y20e ff5 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls17 ws282">
               global minimum is shown in the top right corner. The
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hc y20f ff5 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls10 ws283">
               histogram of the objective function scores at the last
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hc y210 ff5 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls6 ws284">
               iteration is displayed in the second plot. Looking at these two
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hc y211 ff5 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls7 wsc1">
               plots, one can get a general idea about the rate of
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hc y212 ff5 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsc ws285">
               convergence and the distribution of candidate lists at the last
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hc y213 ff5 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls10 ws283">
               iteration. The third plot at the bottom shows the individual
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hc y214 ff5 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsa ws27c">
               lists and the obtained solution along with optional average
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hc y215 ff5 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls6 ws286">
               ranking.
              </div>

              </div>

              <a class="l" href="publication/24026315_RankAggreg_an_R_package_for_weighted_rank_aggregation#pf6" data-dest-detail="[6,&quot;FitR&quot;,0,792,611,0]">
               <div class="d m2" style="border-style:none;position:absolute;left:359.301953px;bottom:705.035278px;width:5.443000px;height:9.694000px;background-color:rgba(255,255,255,0.000001);"></div></a>
              <a class="l" href="publication/24026315_RankAggreg_an_R_package_for_weighted_rank_aggregation#pf6" data-dest-detail="[6,&quot;FitR&quot;,0,792,611,0]">
               <div class="d m2" style="border-style:none;position:absolute;left:133.429123px;bottom:178.421189px;width:5.499000px;height:9.752000px;background-color:rgba(255,255,255,0.000001);"></div></a>

           <div class="pdf-viewer-page"> 
            <div id="pf7" class="pf w0 h0" data-page-no="7">
             <div class="pc pc7 w0 h0">
              <div class="bi x1 y216 w3 h41 lazyload" data-bg="profile/Somnath_Datta2/publication/24026315/viewer/AS:209103138889735@1426865481825/background/7.png" style="background-size: contain;"></div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y40 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls1e ws288">
               that it was ran
               <span class="_ _1"></span>ked numbe
               <span class="_ _1"></span>r 1 in 3 out of 7 lis
               <span class="_ _1"></span>ts. The
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y41 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls40 ws16c">
               rational explanation behind this decision is given by its
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y42 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls113 ws144">
               poor performa
               <span class="_ _16"></span>nce according to the other four m
               <span class="_ _16"></span>easures
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y43 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls6 ws289">
               which rank it towards the end.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y45 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls6 ws86">
               The Genetic Algorithm can also be used with either one
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y46 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls18 ws28a">
               of the two distance measures. Both results agree with the
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y125 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse ws28b">
               ones obtained using the CE algorithm. Besides the
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y47 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls15 ws1fe">
               jaggedness of the minimum path in the first plot of
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y48 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls9 ws28c">
               Figure 2, it is easy to notice that the GA algorithm takes
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y49 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls6 wsf4">
               significantly larger amount of cycles to converge but they
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y4a ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls109 ws1df">
               take less time to complete. Even given that, the
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y4b ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls3b ws28d">
               population distribution of the last generation is much
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y4c ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse ws8a">
               more heterogeneous than that of the CE.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y4e ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls29 ws28e">
               Figure 2: Visual representation of rank aggregation using
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y4f ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsa ws28f">
               the GA algorithm with the Weighted Spearman distance.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 h13 y217 fff fsc fc0 sc0 ls10a ws290">
               Meta-analysis of microarray experiments
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y218 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsf ws291">
               Microarray cancer studies often attempt to identify genes
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y219 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsd5 ws292">
               related to a specific cancer. Their most common
               <span class="_ _2"> </span>output is
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y21a ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls32 ws293">
               a list of genes ordered by corresponding p-values.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y21b ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsc ws85">
               Different studies, even the ones analyzing the same
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y21c ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsb ws294">
               cancer type (for example, lung cancer), almost never
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y21d ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls28 ws295">
               produce identical gene lists. Meta-analysis of multiple
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y21e ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls34 ws296">
               microarray studies is difficult, especially if different
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y21f ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls10b ws98">
               experimental platforms have been used. Rank
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y220 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls10c ws297">
               aggregation, however, avoids the issue of multiple
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y221 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls10d ws298">
               experimental conditions by dealing with the final
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y222 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls6 ws299">
               product: the ordered list of genes.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y223 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls19 ws29a">
               Recently, we carried out a meta-analysis of 20 microarray
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y224 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls5 ws29b">
               studies on multiple cancers using the proposed rank
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y225 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsf ws12a">
               aggregation algorithms [2]. Our goal was to identify
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y226 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsc4 ws29c">
               genes which would be impor
               <span class="ls25 ws29d">tant in development of</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y227 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsd5 ws29e">
               multiple cancers. Further details can be found in the
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y228 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsd ws29f">
               original article. Here, we present a smaller example
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y229 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls5 ws70">
               described by [1] who used three different Monte Carlo
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y22a ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsa ws2a0">
               algorithms for rank aggregation of 5 prostate cancer
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y22b ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls9 ws2a1">
               microarray datasets. Two experiments were conducted
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y22c ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls15 ws2a2">
               using the Affymetrix chip technology and the other three
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y22d ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls5 ws2a3">
               studies used custom cDNA chips. Each individual study
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y22e ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls29 ws2a4">
               tried to identify genes which are either up or down-
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y22f ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls29 ws2a5">
               regulated in prostate cancer patients, resulting in ordered
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y230 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls29 ws2a6">
               lists of upregualated genes shown in Table 3 (the lists
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y231 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls1e ws2a7">
               appear in T
               <span class="_ _1"></span>able 4 in [1]
               <span class="_ _1"></span>).
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y232 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls1e wsae">
               As shown in T
               <span class="_ _1"></span>able 3, ther
               <span class="_ _1"></span>e are 89 uniq
               <span class="_ _1"></span>ue genes in al
               <span class="_ _1"></span>l 5
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y233 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls1e ws2a8">
               gene lists.
               <span class="_ _f"> </span>The only g
               <span class="_ _1"></span>ene that app
               <span class="_ _1"></span>ears in all of t
               <span class="_ _1"></span>hem is
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y234 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls3b ws2a9">
               HPN, while genes AMACR, GDF15, and NME1 appear in
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y235 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsd5 ws2aa">
               4 lists. 66 genes appear in just one list. The goal of rank
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y236 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls7 ws2ab">
               aggregation is to combine thes
               <span class="ls3a ws2ac">e lists into the overall top-</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y237 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls15 ws2ad">
               25 gene list which hopefully would be more accurate
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y238 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls19 ws2ae">
               than any individual list by itself.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x51 h3f y239 ff1b fs1e fc5 sc0 ls1e ws2af">
               0 100
               <span class="_ _28"> </span>300
               <span class="_ _28"> </span>500
              </div>
              <div class="t mc x3e h3f y23a ff1b fs1e fc5 sc0 ls1e ws2b0">
               5.5 6.0 6.5 7.0
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x41 h40 y23b ff1c fs1f fc5 sc0 ls1e ws49">
               Minimum Path
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x17 h3f y23c ff1b fs1e fc5 sc0 ls1e">
               Iteration
              </div>
              <div class="t mc x67 h3f y23d ff1b fs1e fc5 sc0 ls1e">
               Scores
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x9 h3f y23e ff1b fs1e fc5 sc0 ls1e ws287">
               min = 5.552
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x68 h40 y23b ff1c fs1f fc5 sc0 ls1e ws49">
               Final Sample Distribution
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x44 h3f y23c ff1b fs1e fc5 sc0 ls1e ws49">
               Objective function scores
              </div>
              <div class="t mc x4a h3f y23f ff1b fs1e fc5 sc0 ls1e">
               Frequency
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x43 h3f y239 ff1b fs1e fc5 sc0 ls114 ws2b1">
               6789
               <span class="_ _16"></span>1
               <span class="_ _b"></span>0
               <span class="_ _9"></span>1
               <span class="_ _10"></span>1
               <span class="_ _c"></span>1
               <span class="_ _b"></span>2
              </div>
              <div class="t mc x3b h3f y240 ff1b fs1e fc5 sc0 ls10e ws2b2">
               02468
               <span class="_ _16"></span>1
               <span class="_ _10"></span>0
              </div>
              <div class="t mc x3e h3f y241 ff1b fs1e fc5 sc0 ls100 ws277">
               02468 1
               <span class="_ _10"></span>2
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 xb h40 y242 ff1c fs1f fc5 sc0 ls1e ws49">
               Rank Aggregation

               <div class="d m2" style="border-style:none;position:absolute;left:811.870148px;bottom:799.027665px;width:5.499000px;height:9.751000px;background-color:rgba(255,255,255,0.000001);"></div></a>
              <a class="l" href="publication/24026315_RankAggreg_an_R_package_for_weighted_rank_aggregation#pfa" data-dest-detail="[10,&quot;FitR&quot;,0,792,611,0]">
               <div class="d m2" style="border-style:none;position:absolute;left:653.120738px;bottom:780.265173px;width:5.442000px;height:9.695000px;background-color:rgba(255,255,255,0.000001);"></div></a>
              <a class="l" href="publication/24026315_RankAggreg_an_R_package_for_weighted_rank_aggregation#pf7" data-dest-detail="[7,&quot;FitR&quot;,0,792,611,0]">
               <div class="d m2" style="border-style:none;position:absolute;left:635.269140px;bottom:742.650226px;width:5.442000px;height:9.694000px;background-color:rgba(255,255,255,0.000001);"></div></a>
              <a class="l" href="publication/24026315_RankAggreg_an_R_package_for_weighted_rank_aggregation#pfa" data-dest-detail="[10,&quot;FitR&quot;,0,792,611,0]">
               <div class="d m2" style="border-style:none;position:absolute;left:658.221424px;bottom:119.950460px;width:4.195000px;height:8.220000px;background-color:rgba(255,255,255,0.000001);"></div></a>
             </div>
             <div class="pi" data-data="{&quot;ctm&quot;:[1.606515,0.000000,0.000000,1.606515,0.000000,0.000000]}"></div>
            </div> 
           </div> 
           <div class="pdf-viewer-page"> 
            <div id="pf8" class="pf w0 h0" data-page-no="8">
             <div class="pc pc8 w0 h0">
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y40 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsf ws2d0">
               Since no p-values were reported, we use the regular
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y41 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls119 ws2d1">
               Spearman distance for both the CE and the GA
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y42 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls29">
               algorithms.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 h1a y44 ff8 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls5 ws2d2">
               &gt; data(geneLists)
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 h1a y46 ff8 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls11 ws2d3">
               &gt; RankAggreg(geneLists, 25, seed = 100, rho = 0.01)
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y47 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls7 ws2d4">
               Using the CE algorithm with t
               <span class="lse ws2d5">he Spearman distance, the</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y48 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls3f wsa7">
               following ordered list was produced: HPN AMACR
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y49 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls11f ws2d6">
               G
               <span class="_ _10"></span>D
               <span class="_ _10"></span>F
               <span class="_ _10"></span>1
               <span class="_ _7"></span>5F
               <span class="_ _10"></span>A
               <span class="_ _10"></span>S
               <span class="_ _10"></span>NN
               <span class="_ _10"></span>M
               <span class="_ _7"></span>E
               <span class="_ _10"></span>2U
               <span class="_ _10"></span>A
               <span class="_ _10"></span>P
               <span class="_ _10"></span>1S
               <span class="_ _7"></span>L
               <span class="_ _10"></span>C
               <span class="_ _10"></span>2
               <span class="_ _10"></span>5
               <span class="_ _10"></span>A
               <span class="_ _10"></span>60
               <span class="_ _7"></span>A
               <span class="_ _10"></span>C
               <span class="_ _10"></span>T
               <span class="_ _10"></span>2K
               <span class="_ _10"></span>R
               <span class="_ _7"></span>T
               <span class="_ _10"></span>1
               <span class="_ _10"></span>8
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y4a ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls11a ws2d7">
               NME1 EEF2 STRA13 GRP58 CANX SND1 ALCAM
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y4b ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls1f ws2d8">
               MRPL3 TMEM4 CCT2 MTHFD2 SLC19A1 PPIB FM05
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y4c ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls6 wsee">
               ENTPD6 KRT7. The algorithm converged in 38 iterations
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y4d ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls2f ws2d9">
               with the minimum of 319.6. In the overall list, HPN, as
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y4e ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls29 ws2da">
               expected, is in the first place, followed closely by the two
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y4f ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls11 ws27d">
               other genes that appear in four lists.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y51 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls96 ws2db">
               In a case when there would be an indication that some
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y52 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls11 ws4a">
               microarray studies are more reliable than others, we
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y53 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lse ws2dc">
               could set the 
               <span class="ff8 ls11 ws59">importance </span>
               <span class="ls5 ws2dd">parameter available in the</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y54 ff8 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsd ws2de">
               RankAggreg 
               <span class="ff4 ls7 ws2df">function to reflect these beliefs. By default,</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y55 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls3b ws118">
               it assigns equal weights to all ordered lists, but one, for
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y56 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls2f ws2e0">
               example, could set 
               <span class="ff8 ls28 ws2e1">importance </span>
               <span class="ls11b">=<span class="ff8 lsc4">c</span><span class="ls120 ws2e2">(<span class="_ _c"></span>1<span class="_ _c"></span>,2<span class="_ _9"></span>,1<span class="_ _c"></span>,1<span class="_ _c"></span>,2<span class="_ _9"></span>)p<span class="_ _c"></span>l<span class="_ _9"></span>a<span class="_ _c"></span>c<span class="_ _c"></span>i<span class="_ _9"></span>n<span class="_ _c"></span>g</span></span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y57 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls15 ws2e3">
               stronger emphasis on the Affymetrix arrays which are
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y58 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls6 wsc1">
               considered to have higher sensitivity rates.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 h1a y5a ff8 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls2f ws2e4">
               &gt; RankAggreg(geneLists, 25, seed = 100, importance =
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 h1a y5c ff8 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls2f ws2e5">
               + c(1,2,1,1,2), rho = 0.01)
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y5e ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls28 ws2e6">
               This produces the following combined list which is
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y5f ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsd ws2e7">
               slightly different from the one obtained treating all five
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y60 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsf ws2e8">
               studies equally:
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y62 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls121 ws2e9">
               H
               <span class="_ _10"></span>P
               <span class="_ _10"></span>NA
               <span class="_ _10"></span>M
               <span class="_ _10"></span>A
               <span class="_ _10"></span>C
               <span class="_ _10"></span>R0
               <span class="_ _10"></span>A
               <span class="_ _10"></span>C
               <span class="_ _b"></span>T
               <span class="_ _10"></span>2G
               <span class="_ _10"></span>D
               <span class="_ _10"></span>F
               <span class="_ _10"></span>1
               <span class="_ _10"></span>5F
               <span class="_ _10"></span>A
               <span class="_ _10"></span>S
               <span class="_ _10"></span>NN
               <span class="_ _10"></span>M
               <span class="_ _10"></span>E
               <span class="_ _10"></span>2K
               <span class="_ _10"></span>R
               <span class="_ _10"></span>T
               <span class="_ _10"></span>1
               <span class="_ _b"></span>8
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y26a ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls11c ws199">
               SLC25A6 EEF2 UAP1 CANX NME1 GRP58 SND1
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1da ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsb9 ws2ea">
               STRA13 TMEM4 ALCAM PPIB NACA CCT2 RPL5
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1db ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls8 wsbf">
               SLC39A6 MTHFD2 MRPL3 SLC19A1.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1dd ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls6 ws2eb">
               The objective function score here is 295.43, being a little
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1de ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls2f ws2ec">
               smaller than 319.6. Clearly, OACT2 is ranked higher
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1df ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls1e ws2ed">
               now (3rd) du
               <span class="_ _1"></span>e to being at th
               <span class="_ _1"></span>e top (also 3r
               <span class="_ _1"></span>d) in the Welsh
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1e0 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls11 ws2ee">
               study which received more weight. Similarly, the KRT18
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1e1 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls6 ws2ef">
               gene moved up a couple spots due to being present in
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1e2 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls11d wsb3">
               both Welsh and Singh top lists which are both
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1e3 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls9 ws2f0">
               Affymetrix.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1e5 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls34 ws2f1">
               The GA algorithm can also be applied. We increased the
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y26b ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls6 ws2f2">
               maximum number of iterations to allow for a longer
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1e6 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls11 ws2f3">
               evolution process. Increasing the 
               <span class="ff8 ls15 ws2f4">convIn </span>
               <span class="ls12 ws2f5">(converge in)</span>
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1e7 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls5 ws2f6">
               argument to 50 will assure that we do not stop the
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1e8 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsf ws294">
               algorithm too soon. The algorithm did not converge
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1e9 ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls7 ws199">
               (due to setting a rather stringent criteria) and was
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x1 hd y1ea ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls1e ws2f7">
               stopped af
               <span class="_ _1"></span>ter 3000 ge
               <span class="_ _1"></span>neratio
               <span class="_ _1"></span>ns. The fin
               <span class="_ _1"></span>al list had a
               <span class="_ _1"></span>n
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y26c ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls17 ws2f8">
               objective function score of 320.8, which was slightly
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y26d ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 lsd5 ws2f9">
               worse than what we obtained using the CE algorithm.
              </div>
              <div class="t m0 x5 hd y26e ff4 fs6 fc0 sc0 ls18 ws2fa">
               Here is the list found by the GA algorithm:
              </div>

               HPN AMACR SLC25A6 FASN NME2 GDF15 0ACT2
